Articles.Content: I will greatly look forward to the time (pretty soon) where I shall develop invisible aircraft and transparent space stations thanks to this mod ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
1.4 nearing in.

Dev progress for 1.4: amazing.

What I'm doing is going to be truly amazing!

**VERSION 1.4 IS FINALLY RELEASED!**

Finally, through sweat and tears, I bring you the glass dome. 

Fixed a few dozen game-crashing bugs, apparently config files are touchy.

Removed Readmepls file. No need for it now. Enjoy!
Excellent, I shall download right meow :3 I thought the crashes were from some other place :3
Good! Glad I fixed it for ya!

Hi, I noticed the Glass Panes and Enclosures do not turn up in the tech tree of my 1.0.4 Career, and with some notepad sleuthing I have come up with the fix! 

They need the following added to the cfgs and they shall magically appear in the research lab:

    TechRequired = compositesentryCost = 4800

When looking over the stats I noticed some of the items have absurdly high collision resistance and temperature limits. The SuperLarge panel can resist 6 thousand degrees Celcius! Is this intended, or should I bump everything down to normal Structural Panel resilence for the sake of balance? 

If you're interested I can shoot you an email with all the rebalanced stats/costs plus tech tree assignment, or post a dropbox link here.

> 
> it should be kinda heavy and have a low crash tolerance

Why should glass be heavy? It's less dense than steel.

Hi!

I am working on re-balancing in the 1.5 update, as-well as tech-tree integration. Spudman is right, glass shouldn't be heavy but should have low crash tolerance. The bigger the piece, the lower the tolerance, and vise versa. As of the melting point, it is high on purpose. You can tweak it down if you want to, but the original mod will stay the same. Because there is more surface to heat, the bigger the panel, the higher the melting point. Currently the temperature is in Kelvin if I'm not mistaken, so it's not as absurd when you think about it. lol.

- - - Updated - - -

**Update 1.5 is released!**

All parts have been rebalanced.

Glass tube now has fuel crossfeed capabilities.

TechTree integration.

Enjoy!

**Update 1.5.1 is released!**

Fixed entryCost numbers and removed a useless, empty folder! 

Sorry, lol.
I decided to remodel the tube. Thankfully, I don't have to do any config writing! All I have to do is change the name in it.
Having problems. Hold on.
Thanks for the 4000 downloads! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I've tried to make a transparent texture for this but I lack the knowledge. Maybe you'd be interested in making them and include in your mod?

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130196-1-0-4-Procedural-Dynamics-Procedural-Wing-v0-10-0-30-July](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/130196-1-0-4-Procedural-Dynamics-Procedural-Wing-v0-10-0-30-July)

That seems interesting.

I'll take a look. A transparent texture will only work in .png format. The texture is applied unto the model in Unity before exporting. I don't think I'll be able to do much with procedural to be honest.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-07T05:31:40Z" title="08/07/2015 05:31  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 7, 2015</time> by 2001kraft**
The tube is stuck in traffic. Working hard to get a redirect.

Alright! Traffic soaked off, got all my tips together, back to work!

Will be done right soon!

**UPDATE 1.6 IS RELEASED!**

Changed the glass tube model, completely. In the next update, more of these tubes will be added. All of them will be 4m long, but different in diameter.

Changed flags. Now much more realistic than before, and generally look so much better.

Enjoy! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Found a little issue in the \*.cfg's of the glass dome and glass tube cause i havent found them ingame ^^ so i took a look

not glassthings ... | 

MODEL |

{ V

 model = GlassPanesandEnclosures/Parts/Structural/glassdome\_2001kraft/Dome

and the lower edge of the dome is not straight... ok the whole dome is a little crooked but i like domes ^^
Thank you! Will try it!

> not glassthings ... | 
>

> { V
>

> 
> and the lower edge of the dome is not straight... ok the whole dome is a little crooked but i like domes ^^

OH SNAP!

Thanks for showing me that, I completely overlooked it lol

I'll fix that ASAP.

As for the model of the dome itself, yes I know, it's a bit crooked, but it fits together nicely nonetheless ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

If it bothers you too much let me know in this thread and I'll quickly replace it.

Thanks for downloading ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Recently surpassed 12 thousand downloads!

THANK YOU SO MUCH ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
